org.jplot2d.env

Class Environment

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jplot2d.env.Environment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DummyEnvironment, PlotEnvironment

    public abstract class Environment
extends java.lang.Object
    An environment that a plot can be realized. Once a plot is put an environment, changes on the plot can trigger re-layout or redraw, according to the changed property.

    Renderers can be added to an environment to get the rendered result synchronously or asynchronously.

        protected Notifier notifier
        To notify something when ending a command.

      • proxyMap

        protected final java.util.Map<ElementEx,Element> proxyMap
        A impl to proxy map that contains all element in this environment. It's a LinkedHashMap to keep the order of elements added. In case of the same z-order, the adding order take into account.

        Parameters:

        c - the element
        Returns:
        true if the given element a is ancestor of element c

      • getCacheableAncestor

        protected static ComponentEx getCacheableAncestor(ComponentEx comp)
        Returns the first cacheable parent. If all its ancestor are not cacheable, the top ancestor will be returned.
        Parameters:
        comp - the component
        Returns:
        the first cacheable parent

      • beginBatch

        public final BatchToken beginBatch(java.lang.String msg)
        Begin a batch block. In this mode, all update on plot will not be processed, until endBatch is called. If this environment is thread-safe, this method also lock the ReentrantLock, will block other thread call this method.
        Parameters:
        msg - the short description about the batch
        Returns:
        a batch token

      • endBatch

        public final void endBatch(BatchToken token)
        End the batch. All pending update will be committed at once.
        Parameters:
        token - the token gotten from beginBatch

      • endBatch

        public final void endBatch(BatchToken token,
            NoticeType type)
        End the batch. All pending update will be committed at once.
        Parameters:
        token - the token gotten from beginBatch
        type - the type for notice processor

      • isBatch

        protected final boolean isBatch()
        The calling to method must be surrounded by begin() and end().
        Returns:
        if this environment is in batch mode.

      • beginCommand

        protected final void beginCommand(java.lang.String msg)
        A light weight version of beginBatch, without creating a batch token.

        This method is called from element proxy invocation handler before a setter method of the proxy is called.

        Parameters:
        msg - the message for logging

      • endCommand

        protected final void endCommand()
        A light weight version of endBatch, without verifying a batch token. It will never throw an exception in any case.

        This method is called from element proxy invocation handler after a setter method of the proxy is called.

      • begin

        protected final void begin()
        The begin of a block wrapper, to synchronize calling.

      • end

        protected final void end()
        The end of a block wrapper, to synchronize calling.

      • commit

        protected abstract void commit()
        Commit all pending processes in a batch. The isBatch() should remain true while this method is called. This method can be called many times.
